seo.title: LTX-2 Fast AI Video – Text & Image to Video with Audio | MaxVideoAI

technicalOverview.label: Inputs

technicalOverview.label: Audio

promptStructure.title: Prompting LTX-2 Fast
promptStructure.quote: Cinematic [subject] in [environment], [camera move], [lighting/style], [duration 6–20s], 16:9, audio on with [ambience/dialogue/music].
promptStructure.description: Keep it concise: subject + environment + motion + style + duration + audio cue.
steps: Camera move and pacing (fast, slow, tracking, dolly)

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Use 50 fps for crisper motion on 6–10s runs.
Keep one clear action; use seeds/negative prompts to refine.
Audio is on by default—toggle off for cheaper silent drafts.

prompts.title: T2V cinematic test
prompts.prompt: A cowboy walking through a dusty western town at high noon, tracking shot from behind, cinematic depth, realistic lighting, 4K film grain, native ambience.

prompts.title: I2V neon portrait
prompts.prompt: A woman stands still amid a busy neon-lit street at night. The camera slowly dollies in toward her face as people blur past, their motion emphasizing her calm presence. City lights flicker and reflections shift across her denim jacket.
prompts.notes: Set duration 6–10s or 12–20s depending on pace; keep 16:9.

prompts.title: Example prompt – 8s city crosswalk
prompts.prompt: A young woman crosses a busy city street at golden hour, camera tracking her from a low side angle as she steps onto the crosswalk and walks toward the opposite sidewalk. Warm sunlight hits the side of her face, gentle lens flares appear on the edges of the frame, and cars roll past in the background. Audio: soft city ambience (cars, footsteps, distant voices) plus a light upbeat music bed, no dialogue, no on-screen text.

prompts.title: Example prompt – 18–20s office walkthrough
prompts.prompt: One continuous 18–20 second 16:9 shot inside a bright startup office during the day. The camera starts at the entrance as the glass door opens, then walks forward in one smooth motion behind a team lead. We glide past desks with people working on laptops, a whiteboard covered in sketches, and a lounge corner where two colleagues laugh over a prototype. The camera never cuts and finally settles into a medium shot of the team lead stopping by a large window, turning to camera with a relaxed smile. Audio: natural office ambience (typing, low chatter, distant coffee machine) with a gentle motivational music track underneath, no dialogue, no on-screen text.

faqs.q: How long can LTX-2 Fast run?
faqs.a: 6–20 seconds. Durations above 10 seconds must run at 1080p and 25 fps per Fal constraints.
Yes, native audio is on by default. You can toggle it off for silent exports.
16:9 only in the current Fast routing. Use Wan or Pika for flexible ratios.

custom.heroDesc2: Above 10 seconds we automatically keep runs at 1080p/25 fps to match the Fal routing and keep turnarounds reliable.

promptingTabNotes.quick: Quick = variations. Use for fast iteration.
promptingTabNotes.structured: Structured = consistency. Use when you need reliable results.
promptingTabNotes.pro: Pro = continuity. Use for precise, repeatable looks.
promptingTabNotes.storyboard: Storyboard = beat timing. Use for mini-stories in one clip.

promptingTabs.label: Quick
promptingTabs.title: Quick prompt (fast iteration)
promptingTabs.description: Use 1–2 sentences when you want variations.
promptingTabs.copy:
[Subject + action] in [setting], [camera move], [lighting/style], [optional sound cue].
Negative: [text, logos, extra people, blur]

promptingTabs.label: Structured
promptingTabs.title: Structured prompt (best for reliable results)
promptingTabs.description: Separate information so the model can follow it consistently.
promptingTabs.copy:
Subject:
[Who/what + one action.]

Setting:
[Where + time + 2 anchors.]

Camera:
[Shot + angle + one move + lens feel.]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1 cue.]

Negative:
[Text, logos, extra people, blur.]

promptingTabs.label: Pro
promptingTabs.title: Pro prompt (ultra-specific "film crew brief")
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you need a very specific cinematic look or continuity across shots.
promptingTabs.copy:
Brief:
[Goal + vibe.]

Subject + wardrobe:
[Key traits + materials.]

Set:
[Location + anchors.]

Cinematography:
[Framing + angle + one move + lens.]

Lighting + grade:
[Key light + palette.]

Negative:
[What to avoid.]

promptingTabs.label: Storyboard
promptingTabs.title: Storyboard prompt (multi-shot / shot list)
promptingTabs.description: Use this when you want a mini-story in one clip. A storyboard prompt (aka multi-shot / shot list prompt) gives clear timing, camera direction, and continuity. Also called shot-list or sequenced prompts.
promptingTabs.copy:
Mini sequence (same subject + setting)
Beat 1 (start): [action + camera]
Beat 2 (middle): [action + camera]
Beat 3 (end): [final action + settle]

Look:
[Lighting + palette.]

Sound (optional):
[Ambience + 1-2 cues]

troubleshootingItems: Feels random / inconsistent → remove extra beats; rerun 2–3 tight variations.
Motion looks weird → slow the action and keep the camera move simple; reduce background clutter.
Subject drifts off-brand → start from a reference image; keep wardrobe, lighting, and palette consistent.
Text looks wrong → avoid readable signage, tiny UI, labels, and on-screen text.
Dialogue drifts → keep lines short; avoid long monologues.
